memberdef.name: CHECK
memberdef.initializer: do \ { \ if (now & attr) \ { \ if (!(old & attr)) \ fprintf(file, "%s", start); \ } \ else if (old & attr) \ { \ fprintf(file, "%s", end); \ } \ } while (0)

detaileddescription.para:
The following is a workaround for a bug in most versions of ncursesw. Read about it in:
http://article.gmane.org/gmane.comp.lib.ncurses.bugs/2751
In short, if a panel hides one cell of a multi-cell character, then the rest of the characters in that line get screwed. The workaround here is to erase any such character preemptively.
Caveat: If a wide character is erased, and the panel above it is moved enough to expose the entire character, it is not always redrawn.

detaileddescription.para:
Add a workspace.
wm
The window-manager.
ws
The workspace to add.

Switch to a workspace.
wm
The window-manager.
n
Index of the workspace to switch to.
TRUE if the switch was successful.

Switch to the previous workspace from the current one.
wm
The window-manager.

Switch to the next workspace from the current one.
wm
The window-manager.

Move a window to a specific workspace.
wm
The window manager.
neww
The new workspace.
widget
The widget to move.

Find the workspace that contains a specific widget.
wm
The window-manager.
widget
The widget to find.
The workspace that has the widget.

Set the list of workspaces .
wm
The window manager.
workspaces
The list of workspaces.
Process a new window.

Decorate a window.
wm
The window-manager.
widget
The widget to decorate.

Close a window.
wm
The window-manager.
widget
The window to close.

simplesect.para: The idle time of the user.

detaileddescription.para: Process input.

simplesect.para: TRUE of the string was processed, FALSE otherwise.

detaileddescription.para:
Resize a window.
wm
The window manager.
widget
The window to resize.
width
The desired width of the window.
height
The desired height of the window.

Move a window.
wm
The window manager.
widget
The window to move.
x
The desired x-coordinate of the window.
y
The desired y-coordinate of the window.

Update a window.
wm
The window-manager.
widget
The window to update.

detaileddescription.para:
Process a click event.
wm
The window manager.
event
The mouse event.
x
The x-coordinate of the mouse.
y
The y-coordinate of the mouse.
widget
The widget under the mouse.
TRUE if the event was handled, FALSE otherwise.

Raise a window.
wm
The window-manager.
widget
The window to raise.
